findings.rationale: The obligation to maintain confidentiality in perpetuity can lead to indefinite liability, posing a risk to future operations and limiting business flexibility.
findings.evidence_quote: The obligations under this Agreement shall continue in perpetuity and shall survive any termination of discussions between the parties.

findings.rationale: The indemnification clause without limits could expose a party to significant financial liability, especially in cases of extensive breaches or claims.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party shall indemnify and hold harmless the other party from and against all claims, losses, damages, and expenses, without limit.

findings.rationale: The absence of liability limitations increases financial exposure in case of disputes or breaches, which can be detrimental to business sustainability.
findings.evidence_quote: Notwithstanding any other provision, neither party's liability shall be limited under this Agreement.

findings.rationale: The clause assigning all rights of work product to Company A could limit the rights of the other party, affecting their ability to use their own contributions.
findings.evidence_quote: All work product and deliverables created hereunder shall be owned exclusively by Company A.

findings.rationale: The provision allowing recovery of attorneys' fees can incentivize litigation, potentially increasing costs for the non-prevailing party.
findings.evidence_quote: The prevailing party in any dispute shall be entitled to recover all attorneys' fees and costs from the non-prevailing party.
